title: Life of Jane Welsh Carlyle,
author: Ireland, Annie Elizabeth (Nicholson)
snippet: The discomforts of Humbie had been too much for both husband  and wife — they went afterwards to Auchtertool, as we have said, and Carlyle subsequently into Annandale, to his own people.

title: Life of Jane Welsh Carlyle,
author: Ireland, Annie Elizabeth (Nicholson)
snippet: It was not at the Manse that the Carlyles were now staying,  but at a large comfortable house lent by a Mr. Liddell, 'where,' as Mrs. Carlyle writes to her friend Mr. George Cooke, * we should have done very well had not Mr. C. walked and rode and bathed himself into a bilious crisis, just before leaving Humbie.'

title: Life of Jane Welsh Carlyle,
author: Ireland, Annie Elizabeth (Nicholson)
snippet: The visit to Humbie was not a success.

title: Life of Jane Welsh Carlyle,
author: Ireland, Annie Elizabeth (Nicholson)
snippet: Mrs. Carlyle, in very frail health, went first to Haddington and joined her husband at Humbie after a few days' rest.

title: Life of Jane Welsh Carlyle,
author: Ireland, Annie Elizabeth (Nicholson)
snippet: Rooms had been found in the farm-house of Humbie, near Aberdour, and thither Carlyle went by steamer, with the servant, Charlotte, his horse, and 'the blessed' (Nero).
